intro lead: Welcome to lib.reviews! We're building a free and open platform for reviewing absolutely anything, in any language.
intro message:
Why? Because we believe the world's reviews should be organized by a community, not for profit, without ads, and with a strong commitment to integrity and quality. We also believe in separating reviews from the people offering you the thing that you're reviewing, to reduce conflicts of interest.

Right now we're working on the code. Here are a few things you can do:
to do list:
• Create an account and write a review. Reviews will only show up in the feed for now, and you can't do fancy things like uploading images or adding metadata yet.
  • Work on any of our open issues
  • Liberate your existing reviews using freeyourstuff.cc
  • Join our discussion list and share your thoughts about this project
find us on: You can find us on GitHub, on Twitter and on IRC (#libreviews on irc.freenode.net).

agree to terms:

pick any url:
We use web addresses (URLs) as the primary way to identify things we review. Pick any web address that describes the place/object/thing you're reviewing, e.g. an official website, the address for the item on a shop website, or any other URL that identifies it.

The community will merge reviews that are describing the same thing (check out the feed to help!).
title: Title
enter title: Enter a title, e.g.: Amazing waterfalls, but very crowded
pick a title:
A good headline will tell readers what the most important takeaways from your review are.

Don't bury the lede — for example, if a product broke after 3 months, or if a restaurant gave you food poisoning, you'll probably want to mention it here! :-)
write your review:
Write your review in plain text, or use markdown for formatting. A few things to keep in mind:
  • Be fair — please be careful with generalizations, positive or negative.
  • Be honest — that includes disclosing any conflicts of interest of your own (e.g., if you work for a competitor).
  • Be kind — this website is used by humans.
There is no length requirement, but star ratings without any explanation may be deleted.
